trial_identification.studytitle: Serum anti-mullarian hormone levels in women with unexplained recurrent pregnancy loss.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: comparison between serum antimullarian hormone (AMH) in women with history of unexplained recurrent pregnancy loss and multiparous healthy volunteers with comparable age and body mass index ( BMI)

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: measurement of serum antimullarian hormone (AMH) by radio immunoassay (RIA) once at time of participant recruitment during early follicular phase of any menstrual cycle in non-pregnant women with history of two or more pregnancy losses before 12 weeks within the last two years.
interventions.comparator: measurement of AMH in non pregnant healthy multiparous volunteers with comparable age and BMI.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Single measurement at inclusion in study - that is, when participant is recruited into this trial

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: cases were non-pregnant women with history of 2 or more successive spontaneous pregnancy losses between 6 weeks and 12 weeks gestational age within the last 2 years, while the key inclusion criteria for control group was giving birth of a full term baby within the last 2 years.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: presence of a disease or condition that explains the cause of pregnancy loss.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Alexandria faculty of medicine, Azarita, Alexandria, Egypt. postal code: 03312

ethicsAndSummary.summary: comparison of serum AMH values in two groups; study group comprising 30 women with recurrent unexplained miscarriages between 6 and 12 weeks, and control group of multiparous women of comparable age, and BMI with recent delivery of a full term baby.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Alexandria Faculty of Medicine institutional review board .
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Faculty of Medicine, Alexandria University. Azarita, Aexandria, Egypt. 03312
